title: Shiro Plum  My First Fruit & How You Can Grow One Too #shorts

tasks.task: Planting and caring for a Shiro plum tree
subtasks: Identify the type of plum tree (Shiro, Japanese variety)
Note the tree's expected ripening period (July) and growing zone (5-9, zone 8B in this case)
Describe the tree's growth potential and mention pruning to manage size
Mention pruning activities (done in late winter)
State when the tree starts producing fruit (3rd to 5th year after planting)
Discuss pollination needs (partially self-pollinating but benefits from a compatible pollinator)
Describe fruit development (starts green, ripens to yellow; check ripeness by color and touch)
Explain harvesting technique (gently twist when slightly soft for optimal flavor)
Mention uses for the fruit (fresh eating, jams, desserts)
